result.execSummary:
The defendant Cornelius L Blain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber for work; good time granted

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable surcharges, costs and supervision fees. Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

Seek and maintain employment.
Job and vocational training.

No controlled substances or alcohol; AODA assessment and treatment.
No contact with the victim. Jose N.

Urine screens.
Anger management counseling.
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling. 
Court set restitution at zero.

timeConds.notes: To be used at the discretion of the agent for any violations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cornelius L Blain

records.addlTxt: Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($10,000 sig bond) gj

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Paraties stipulate to a $1,000.00 signature bond; Court granted same and ordered all conditions of the No Contact Order remain.

Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant sworn, examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty of the charge in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Victim notification needed; State's request for adjournment was granted by the Court.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing before Branch 20 on 4/23/14 at 8:30 a.m.

(The motion hearing and speedy jury trial date are vacated).

Defendant Cornelius L Blain in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Cornelius L Blain in custody.  Jay R. Pucek appeared on behalf of Kimberly D. Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
/submitted by the State, charging defendant with Battery, a Class A Misdemeanor, contrary to Wis. Stats. section 940.19(1).
Arguments as to bail heard.  Court ordered cash bail set in the amount of $3,500.00.  No contact order remains in effect.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Case must be filed on or before: 6/16/14.

Attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood in court, defendant Cornelius L Blain not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant returned on the warrant.   Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Court set the following motion schedule:  movant has until 4/07/14 to file; response due 4/28/14; reply due by 5/05/14.  All motions in limine, jury instructions and witness lists are due within one week of the final pretrial date.  Court ordered case continued before Branch 20.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 3/13/14.  Bench Warrant in file.  Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 20.

Attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood in court.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared via telephone for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Case set for bail hearing to address justice point violations. Defendant not in court, was notified by Attorney Lockwood of court date today. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court ordered signature bond forfeited.

Justice Point GPS Violation report received and filed. Court ordered the be set on calendar to address this violation. Parties notified. Case scheduled for 03/12/2014 at 8:30 a.m. for Bail Hearing in Branch 20.

Defense counsel contacted the court and informed the court the defendant no longer wishes to enter a plea in this matter and instead requests a jury trial date. Defense counsel requests this matter be heard in court prior to scheduled plea/sentencing date. Parties notified. Case set for scheduling conference on 03/18/2014 at 1:30 p.m. in Branch 20.
Justice Point violation report, GPS violatoin-Inclusion Zone, received and filed. Court took no further action at this time. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Pretrial Electronic Monitoring (GPS) Program Order for Supervision (Amended), signed and filed.  Copy provided to defendant.
Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.  Court ordered all conditions of bail to continue and vacated the 3/06/14 scheduling date.

Defendant Cornelius L Blain in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Entry made without file, as case was just added at defense counsel's request and with no objection by the State.  Copy of the docket and Criminal Complaint were provided to the Court.  Bail motion by defense to modify the GPS monitoring in this case was heard, as State did not object.  Court ordered GPS monitoring to include release for grocery shopping for up to 2 days per week, no longer than 1-1/2 hours each time; release also allowed for verifiable employment and legal appointments for both court and attorney meetings.  All other conditions of bail remain, inlcuding the No Contact Order.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court orders other terms and conditions of bail to remain the same.

Stipulation to a bail modification is agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.
Court orders bail AMENDED to a $10, 000 SIGNATURE BOND.

Defendant Cornelius L Blain in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Cornelius L Blain in custody.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JOSE N.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring (24 HOUR CURFEW).

Defendant Cornelius L Blain in court with attorney Reyna I Morales.  Defendant Cornelius L Blain in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
